clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Local Infiltration Versus Epidural Following Liver Resection 2
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Trial of Peri-operative Nerve Block and Continuous Infusion of Local Anaesthetic Via Wound Catheter Versus Epidural in Patients Undergoing Open Liver Resection.

oversight_info.authority: Scotland: Academic and Clinical Central Office for Research and Development (ACCORD)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators plan to compare epidurals versus wound catheters for effects on pain relief and recovery following open liver surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurement made on day of discharge which is expected to be on average bewteen 5 and 10 days after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Number of days (to nearest half day) patients stay in hospital.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Performed daily at 0900 hours. On the day of surgery pain scores will be performed at 2, 6 and 12 hours post surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analogue scores of pain experienced.
Mean Central Venous Pressure during liver transection will be quantified and compared between groups.

other_outcome.time_frame: Day of surgery and postoperative days 1-7
Day of Surgery and postoperative days 1-7
day of surgery and post-operative days 1-30

other_outcome.measure: Post-operative blood tests (FBC, U&E, LFTs, coag)

arm_group.description: Standard epidural, pre-operative insertion, to be run for 48 hours

intervention.description: Wound catheter, placed at end of procedure, prior to closure. To be kept in for 48 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing open hepatic resection for benign or malignant conditions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with contraindication to either epidural or wound catheter techniques.
- Inability to give written, informed consent.
- Jaundice (Bilirubin > 100 Î¼mol/L)
- Liver resection combined with secondary surgical procedure.
- Age < 18 years
- Pregnant women
- patients on long term opiates for chronic pain

reference.citation: Revie EJ, McKeown DW, Wilson JA, Garden OJ, Wigmore SJ.
